text: we met about 20 years ago he was in a
couple of my a level classes with me I
was very aware of him always following
me around college I wasn't aware back
then what stalking was when you're 16 to
18 you don't really understand you just
think of it some strange bloke with a
with a crush on me and I try to ignore
him and he did he followed me quite a
lot but as soon as we left college I
thought that was it and then
unfortunately ten years later he got in
touch with me again and that's really
when the stalking started so what what
happened then what sort of things was he
doing it started first of all where I
work they were commenting that someone
had kept coming in asking information
about me wanting my personal details and
around that time I then started to
receive anonymous emails flowers and
cards sent to my place of work and so
the only way I could track who this was
was to look at the CCTV footage at work
and once I looked at it on the dates
that he'd come in to work asking about
me I could see it was him and I wasn't
surprised to see that that was him were
you anxious were you frightened or were
you slightly bewildered I was anxious
quite early on and I think that's
because of what I'd experienced at
college him being very strange always
sort of you know hiding behind a bush
and waiting for me and following me so
he made me feel nervous in college and
then I did I was concerned that you know
there's a 10-year gap and here he is
back in my life again and it continued
in lots of sightings of him around by
where I work my parents home they live
in a very quiet cul-de-sac and he'd be
jogging up there in this quiet
cul-de-sac on Christmas Day and you know
family days where I would be round there
and yes there was always just he seemed
to be wherever I went he was there it
was a very good outcome yesterday that
has been a long time coming this
particular breach of the restraining
order the issue of him accessing the
civil courts in order to bring vexatious
complaints against me
as you know we've spoken in the past
that was that I've had that breach twice
before against me and the CPS dropped
the prosecution for that breach back in
2011 that left me very vulnerable
I felt very open for Fogle to do that
again and obviously he did but I'm
obviously very pleased that the
prosecution went ahead and they were
successful psychologically what
difference does it make to you knowing
that he is behind bars again well it's
how I felt
it gives me respite you know I can't
deny that when he's out of prison
obviously I have that constant awareness
and fear and looking over my shoulder oh
I I deal with that a lot better now I
made a decision and I think you get to a
point as a victim that you want to be a
survivor and in order to survive this
crime you almost have to put your
stalker in a box and get on with your
life regardless and that's really what
I've been trying to do tell our audience
about the impact on you and your family
of this campaign of stalking which has
gone on for over a decade and as I
mentioned in the introduction you know
searching your name on the internet
turning up at work turning up at home
breaking into your car pretending to be
a prospective parent at your child's
nursery I mean that what you've just
said is actually one of the the claims
that he made against me because that
wasn't proved in a court of law
however that information was given to me
by a police officer so that's the only
way I knew that he had been to my
daughter's nursery otherwise I wouldn't
have known that it hurt it had and it
still does to some to some degree have a
huge impact on my life you know on our
lives a family's life we we every
decision that we make we have to
consider this man often and what we do
although I'm trying to do that less and
less as I said I want to get on with my
life and and live my life so but it had
a huge psychological impact there was
I've said it time and time again
stalking is a psychological crime it's a
crime of great terror and it's not often
recognized
haven't been for many years you know if
you don't have bruises and there isn't
physical violence people aren't
understanding the huge emotional impact
that stalking has on a victims life
